ground_truth: Rick sits down at the table; as they talk, Captain Tonelli and Lieutenant Casselle walk by toward the entrance of the cafe. It intermittently sheds its light on Rick's face. Casselle talks non-stop, and Tonelli tries. They both stop, salute Renault, and walk into the cafe. Rick laughs. Rick and Renault look up when they hear the BUZZ of a plane taking off from the adjacent airfield. The plane flies directly over their heads. Rick still looks in the direction of the airport; his look isn't a happy one. The three men enter the cafe and pass Sam at the piano. Rick pats Sam on the shoulder. Rick's eyes react, and involuntarily, they glance toward the gambling room. Renault catches the look. They start upstairs to Rick's office, passing Casselle who is still haranguing Tonelli. They go inside the office, and Rick opens up the safe in a small, dark room just off the office. Only Rick's shadow can be seen getting the money out. Rick moves out of the shadows and into view, giving the money to Emil, who departs. Rick closes the door to the office, then goes over to close the safe. Renault watches Rick's reaction, and they sit down to discuss the matter in earnest. Rick makes a face. Renault stands up but stops short as his AIDE enters. Renault starts to leave and hurries away. Rick smiles cynically. Renault walks up to Carl, then over to one of his officers. The officer salutes and goes off to speak to the guards. Renault walks over to Strasser's table as Rick comes down the stairs. Renault sits down. Ugarte stands at the roulette table. Two gendarmes approach him from behind, and the officer nods. They follow Ugarte to the cashier's window, where Ugarte puts his chips through the window to the CASHIER and looks around. We move to Strasser's table, who has witnessed the event. Guards and gendarmes rush in and grab Ugarte. Rick stands impassively as they drag Ugarte off. Back to Rick, still standing where he was, as a CUSTOMER walks by. An air of tense expectancy pervades the room. Rick comes out to the middle of the floor and speaks in a very calm voice. A few customers are on the point of leaving. Rick glances toward Sam, who nods and begins to play. Renault, Strasser, and Heinze sit calmly at their table after witnessing the arrest. Rick walks by, stops, and comes over to their table. Rick nods to Strasser and Heinze and sits down with them. Major Strasser is one of the reasons the Third Reich enjoys the reputation it has today. Strasser takes a little black book from his pocket and turns to a certain page.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Rick perches down at the table; as they converse, Captain Tonelli and Lieutenant Casselle stroll by toward the entrance of the café. It sporadically sheds its illumination on Rick's visage. Casselle chats non-stop, and Tonelli attempts. They both halt, salute Renault, and walk into the café. Rick chuckles. Rick and Renault glance up when they detect the HUM of a plane departing from the nearby airfield. The plane soars directly over their heads. Rick still gazes in the direction of the airport; his expression isn't a joyful one. The three men enter the café and pass Sam at the piano. Rick taps Sam on the shoulder. Rick's eyes respond, and involuntarily, they glimpse toward the gambling room. Renault catches the expression. They commence upstairs to Rick's office, passing Casselle who is still hectoring Tonelli. They enter the office, and Rick opens up the safe in a small, dim room just off the office. Only Rick's silhouette can be seen getting the cash out. Rick moves out of the shadows and into sight, giving the cash to Emil, who departs. Rick shuts the door to the office, then goes over to close the safe. Renault observes Rick's reaction, and they sit down to discuss the matter in earnest. Rick makes a grimace. Renault stands up but halts short as his AIDE enters. Renault begins to leave and hurries away. Rick grins sardonically. Renault walks up to Carl, then over to one of his officers. The officer salutes and goes off to speak to the guards. Renault walks over to Strasser's table as Rick descends the stairs. Renault sits down. Ugarte stands at the roulette table. Two gendarmes approach him from behind, and the officer nods. They follow Ugarte to the cashier's window, where Ugarte puts his chips through the window to the TELLER and looks around. We move to Strasser's table, who has observed the event. Guards and gendarmes rush in and seize Ugarte. Rick stands impassively as they drag Ugarte off. Back to Rick, still standing where he was, as a PATRON walks by. An air of tense expectation pervades the room. Rick emerges to the middle of the floor and speaks in a very calm voice. A few patrons are on the point of leaving. Rick glances toward Sam, who nods and begins to play. Renault, Strasser, and Heinze sit calmly at their table after witnessing the arrest. Rick walks by, stops, and comes over to their table. Rick nods to Strasser and Heinze and sits down with them. Major Strasser is one of the reasons the Third Reich enjoys the reputation it has today. Strasser takes a little black book from his pocket and turns to a specific page.

Toward Sam, Rick glances, who nods and begins to play. Calmly sit Renault, Strasser, and Heinze at their table after the arrest is witnessed by them. By, Rick walks, stops, and to their table comes over. To Strasser and Heinze, Rick nods and with them sits down. One of the reasons the Third Reich enjoys the reputation it has today is Major Strasser. From his pocket is taken a little black book by Strasser, and to a certain page, he turns.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Rick settles himself comfortably at the table, and as the conversation unfolds, Captain Tonelli and Lieutenant Casselle make their way toward the entrance of the bustling cafe. The light intermittently casts its glow on Rick's face, creating a dynamic play of shadows. Casselle is engaged in a continuous stream of chatter, while Tonelli makes an effort to keep up. They both pause momentarily to salute Renault before proceeding into the cafe. Rick lets out a laugh. Both Rick and Renault look up with interest when they hear the distinct BUZZ of a plane taking off from the nearby airfield. The plane soars directly overhead. Rick continues to gaze in the direction of the airport, and his expression is far from cheerful. The three men enter the cafe, passing by Sam, who is seated at the piano. Rick gives Sam a friendly pat on the shoulder. Rick's eyes involuntarily flicker toward the gambling room, and Renault notices this glance. They begin their ascent to Rick's office, passing Casselle, who is still energetically haranguing Tonelli. Once inside the office, Rick opens the safe in a small, dimly lit room adjacent to the office. Only Rick's shadow is visible as he retrieves the money. Emerging from the shadows, Rick hands the money to Emil, who then departs. Rick closes the office door and proceeds to secure the safe. Renault observes Rick's reaction closely, and they both sit down to discuss the matter seriously. Rick makes a face, expressing his thoughts. Renault stands up but halts abruptly as his AIDE enters the room. Renault begins to leave and quickly hurries away. Rick offers a cynical smile. Renault approaches Carl and then moves over to one of his officers. The officer salutes and goes off to communicate with the guards. Renault makes his way to Strasser's table just as Rick descends the stairs. Renault takes a seat. Ugarte is positioned at the roulette table. Two gendarmes approach him stealthily from behind, and the officer gives a nod. They follow Ugarte to the cashier's window, where Ugarte hands his chips through the window to the CASHIER and glances around cautiously. We shift our focus to Strasser's table, where he has been observing the unfolding events. Guards and gendarmes rush in and seize Ugarte. Rick stands impassively as Ugarte is dragged away. Returning to Rick, who remains standing in the same spot, a CUSTOMER walks by. An air of tense expectancy fills the room. Rick steps out to the center of the floor and speaks in a calm, composed voice. A few customers appear to be on the verge of leaving. Rick casts a glance toward Sam, who nods and begins to play. Renault, Strasser, and Heinze sit composedly at their table, having witnessed the arrest. Rick walks by, pauses, and approaches their table. Rick nods to Strasser and Heinze before sitting down with them. Major Strasser is one of the reasons the Third Reich has the formidable reputation it holds today. Strasser retrieves a small black book from his pocket and turns to a specific page.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Rick comfortably settles himself at the sturdy, well-worn table, and as the conversation naturally unfolds, Captain Tonelli and Lieutenant Casselle make their way toward the entrance of the bustling, lively cafe. The light intermittently casts its glow on Rick's face, creating a dynamic and ever-changing play of shadows across his features. Casselle enthusiastically engages in a continuous stream of animated chatter, while Tonelli makes a concerted effort to keep up with his energetic companion. They both pause momentarily to respectfully salute Renault before proceeding further into the cafe. A laugh escapes Rick's lips, carrying a hint of amusement. Both Rick and Renault look up with keen interest when they hear the distinct and familiar BUZZ of a plane taking off from the nearby, busy airfield. The plane soars majestically directly overhead. Rick continues to fix his gaze in the direction of the airport, and his expression is notably far from cheerful. The three men enter the cafe, passing by Sam, who is absorbed in playing the piano. Rick gives Sam a friendly pat on the shoulder, a gesture of camaraderie. Rick's eyes involuntarily flicker toward the gambling room, and Renault, ever observant, notices this glance. They begin their ascent to Rick's office, passing Casselle, who is still energetically haranguing Tonelli with unending vigor. Once inside the private haven of his office, Rick opens the safe in a small, dimly lit room adjacent to the main office space. Only Rick's shadow is visible as he retrieves the money from the safe's depths. Emerging from the shadows, Rick hands the money to Emil, who then promptly departs. Rick closes the office door firmly and meticulously secures the safe once again. Renault observes Rick's reaction closely, and they both settle down to discuss the matter at hand with seriousness. Rick makes a face, expressing his thoughts without uttering a word. Renault stands up but halts abruptly as his AIDE enters the room unexpectedly. Renault begins to leave, quickly hurrying away with purpose. Rick offers a cynical smile in response. Renault approaches Carl and then moves over to one of his officers, who salutes him and promptly goes off to communicate with the guards. Renault makes his way to Strasser's table just as Rick descends the stairs with measured steps. Renault takes a seat at the table. Ugarte is strategically positioned at the roulette table, his eyes darting around. Two gendarmes approach him stealthily from behind, and the officer gives a discreet nod. They follow Ugarte to the cashier's window, where Ugarte hands his chips through the window to the CASHIER, glancing around cautiously and nervously. We shift our focus to Strasser's table, where he has been intently observing the unfolding events with a keen eye. Guards and gendarmes rush in and seize Ugarte with swift precision. Rick stands impassively, his expression unreadable, as Ugarte is dragged away. Returning to Rick, who remains standing in the same spot, a CUSTOMER casually walks by. An air of tense expectancy fills the room, hanging heavily in the atmosphere. Rick steps out to the center of the floor and speaks in a calm, composed voice that cuts through the tension. A few customers appear to be on the verge of leaving, their curiosity piqued. Rick casts a knowing glance toward Sam, who nods in silent understanding and begins to play. Renault, Strasser, and Heinze sit composedly at their table, having closely witnessed the arrest unfold before them. Rick walks by with deliberate steps, pauses for a moment, and then approaches their table. Rick nods to Strasser and Heinze in greeting before sitting down with them. Major Strasser represents one of the reasons the Third Reich has the formidable and fearsome reputation it holds today. Strasser retrieves a small, black book from his pocket, turning to a specific page with deliberate intent.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Rick carefully lowers himself into the chair at the table, settling in as the conversation begins to flow. Meanwhile, Captain Tonelli and Lieutenant Casselle make their way toward the entrance of the cafe, their footsteps echoing softly. The light from outside flickers intermittently, casting brief illuminations on Rick's face. Casselle chatters incessantly, while Tonelli makes an effort to keep up with the conversation. As they approach, both men come to a halt, offering a respectful salute to Renault before continuing their path into the cafe. Rick lets out a laugh, a sound that mingles with the ambient noise. Suddenly, the distinct BUZZ of a plane taking off from the nearby airfield captures Rick and Renault's attention, prompting them to look up. The plane soars directly overhead, its presence momentarily dominating the scene. Rick's gaze lingers in the direction of the airport, his expression clouded with discontent. As the three men enter the cafe, they pass by Sam, who is seated at the piano. Rick acknowledges Sam with a gentle pat on the shoulder, a silent gesture of camaraderie. Rick's eyes flicker with a reaction, and almost involuntarily, they dart toward the gambling room, a movement not lost on Renault. Sensing the unspoken cue, they begin their ascent to Rick's office, navigating past Casselle, who continues to engage Tonelli with fervent discourse. Once inside the office, Rick steps into a small, dimly lit room adjacent to the main space, where he opens the safe. Only his shadow is visible as he retrieves the money. Emerging from the shadows, Rick hands the money to Emil, who promptly departs. Rick then closes the office door with a decisive motion and proceeds to secure the safe. Renault observes Rick's demeanor closely as they both take their seats to delve into a serious discussion. Rick's face contorts momentarily, expressing a fleeting emotion. Renault rises from his seat but pauses abruptly as his AIDE enters the room. Without delay, Renault begins to leave, moving with urgency. Rick's lips curl into a cynical smile as he watches Renault's departure. Renault approaches Carl, exchanging a few words before moving on to one of his officers. The officer acknowledges Renault with a salute and then strides off to relay instructions to the guards. Renault makes his way to Strasser's table just as Rick descends the stairs. Taking a seat, Renault joins Strasser. Meanwhile, Ugarte stands at the roulette table, his presence noted by two gendarmes who approach him from behind. The officer gives a subtle nod, signaling the gendarmes to follow Ugarte to the cashier's window. There, Ugarte slides his chips through the window to the CASHIER, casting a wary glance around the room. The scene shifts to Strasser's table, where he observes the unfolding events with keen interest. Suddenly, guards and gendarmes surge forward, seizing Ugarte. Rick remains impassive, his expression unchanged as Ugarte is forcibly removed from the scene. As the tension in the room heightens, Rick stands rooted to his spot, even as a CUSTOMER passes by. An air of tense expectancy envelops the room, thick and palpable. Rick steps into the center of the floor, his voice calm and steady as he addresses the room. A few customers, sensing the shift in atmosphere, prepare to leave. Rick's gaze finds Sam, who acknowledges the silent cue with a nod and begins to play. Renault, Strasser, and Heinze remain seated at their table, composed and unruffled after witnessing the arrest. Rick walks past them, pauses, and then approaches their table. He nods to Strasser and Heinze before taking a seat with them. Major Strasser, a figure of significance, is emblematic of the Third Reich's formidable reputation. With deliberate movements, Strasser retrieves a small black book from his pocket, flipping to a specific page with intent.

Rick approaches their table, nods to Strasser and Heinze, and joins them. Strasser, a key figure in the Third Reich's reputation, takes out a little black book and turns to a specific page.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Rick sits down at the table; as they talk, Captain Tonelli, an officer known for his sharp instincts in law enforcement, and Lieutenant Casselle, renowned for his ceaseless chatter, walk by toward the entrance of the cafe. It intermittently sheds its light on Rick's face. Casselle talks non-stop, and Tonelli tries to keep up with his animated conversation. They both stop, salute Renault, the local prefect of police who wields significant influence over the area, and walk into the cafe. Rick laughs. Rick and Renault look up when they hear the BUZZ of a plane taking off from the adjacent airfield, which is part of a network of strategic facilities used by the military. The plane flies directly over their heads. Rick still looks in the direction of the airport; his look isn't a happy one, possibly recalling unpleasant memories. The three men enter the cafe and pass Sam at the piano, a local legend who entertains the patrons with his soulful music. Rick pats Sam on the shoulder, a gesture of camaraderie. Rick's eyes react, and involuntarily, they glance toward the gambling room, a popular spot for those looking to try their luck and discreetly conduct other business deals. Renault catches the look, understanding the implications. They start upstairs to Rick's office, passing Casselle who is still haranguing Tonelli with his animated storytelling. They go inside the office, and Rick opens up the safe in a small, dark room just off the office, a space only a few trusted individuals have seen. Only Rick's shadow can be seen getting the money out. Rick moves out of the shadows and into view, giving the money to Emil, his trusted aide who handles discreet transactions, who departs. Rick closes the door to the office, then goes over to close the safe. Renault watches Rick's reaction, aware of the potential risks involved, and they sit down to discuss the matter in earnest. Rick makes a face, contemplating the seriousness of their conversation. Renault stands up but stops short as his AIDE enters, ready to deliver urgent news. Renault starts to leave and hurries away. Rick smiles cynically, recognizing the usual political maneuvering at play. Renault walks up to Carl, his efficient and loyal assistant, then over to one of his officers. The officer salutes and goes off to speak to the guards. Renault walks over to Strasser's table, who is a high-ranking Nazi official overseeing operations in the region, as Rick comes down the stairs. Renault sits down. Ugarte, a notorious black market dealer known for trading in valuable documents, stands at the roulette table. Two gendarmes approach him from behind, and the officer nods, signaling an impending arrest. They follow Ugarte to the cashier's window, where Ugarte puts his chips through the window to the CASHIER and looks around, aware of the attention he's attracting. We move to Strasser's table, who has witnessed the event with a calculated interest. Guards and gendarmes rush in and grab Ugarte, executing an arrest that could have larger implications. Rick stands impassively as they drag Ugarte off, maintaining his calm demeanor. Back to Rick, still standing where he was, as a CUSTOMER walks by, sensing the tension in the air. An air of tense expectancy pervades the room, as patrons are uncertain of what will happen next. Rick comes out to the middle of the floor and speaks in a very calm voice, attempting to diffuse the situation. A few customers are on the point of leaving, wary of the unexpected turn of events. Rick glances toward Sam, who nods and begins to play a familiar tune that calms the atmosphere. Renault, Strasser, and Heinze, another official with ties to the German military, sit calmly at their table after witnessing the arrest, discussing its potential impact. Rick walks by, stops, and comes over to their table. Rick nods to Strasser and Heinze and sits down with them, acknowledging the delicate power dynamics present. Major Strasser is one of the reasons the Third Reich enjoys the reputation it has today, with his decisive leadership and ruthless tactics. Strasser takes a little black book from his pocket, a well-guarded record of sensitive information, and turns to a certain page, contemplating his next move.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Rick sits down at the table as they talk. Captain Tonelli and Lieutenant Casselle walk by toward the entrance of the cafe. It intermittently sheds its light on Rick's face. Casselle talks nonstop and Tonelli tries. They both stop salute Renault and walk into the cafe. Rick laughs. Rick and Renault look up when they hear the BUZZ of a plane taking off from the adjacent airfield. The plane flies directly over their heads. Rick still looks in the direction of the airport. his look is not a happy one. The three men enter the cafe and pass Sam at the piano. Rick pats Sam on the shoulder. Rick's eyes react and involuntarily they glance toward the gambling room. Renault catches the look. They start upstairs to Rick's office passing Casselle who is still haranguing Tonelli. They go inside the office and Rick opens up the safe in a small dark room just off the office. Only Rick's shadow can be seen getting the money out. Rick moves out of the shadows and into view giving the money to Emil who departs. Rick closes the door to the office then goes over to close the safe. Renault watches Rick's reaction and they sit down to discuss the matter in earnest. Rick makes a face. Renault stands up but stops short as his AIDE enters. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Renault starts to leave and hurries away. Rick smiles cynically. Renault walks up to Carl then over to one of his officers. The officer salutes and goes off to speak to the guards. Renault walks over to Strasser's table as Rick comes down the stairs. Renault sits down. Ugarte stands at the roulette table. Two gendarmes approach him from behind and the officer nods. They follow Ugarte to the cashier's window where Ugarte puts his chips through the window to the CASHIER and looks around. We move to Strasser's table who has witnessed the event. Guards and gendarmes rush in and grab Ugarte. Rick stands impassively as they drag Ugarte off. Back to Rick still standing where he was as a CUSTOMER walks by. An air of tense expectancy pervades the room. Rick comes out to the middle of the floor and speaks in a very calm voice. A few customers are on the point of leaving. Rick glances toward Sam who nods and begins to play Renault. Strasser and Heinze sit calmly at their table after witnessing the arrest. Rick walks by stops and comes over to their table. Rick nods to Strasser and Heinze and sits down with them. Major Strasser is one of the reasons the Third Reich enjoys the reputation it has today. Strasser takes a little black book from his pocket and turns to a certain page.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Gary sprawls onto the couch; as they whisper, Doctor Fern and Professor Langley stroll by toward the threshold of the bakery. It sporadically flickers its glow on Gary's forehead. Langley sighs continuously, and Fern attempts. They both pause, wave at Smith, and stroll into the bakery. Gary chuckles. Gary and Smith glance over when they catch the HUM of a helicopter soaring from the nearby racetrack. The helicopter zooms directly above their feet. Gary continues to gaze in the direction of the hangar; his expression isn't a cheerful one. The trio strides into the bakery and bypasses Tim at the drums. Gary taps Tim on the knee. Gary's eyebrows twitch, and automatically, they peer toward the library. Smith notices the glance. They climb downstairs to Gary's den, passing Langley who is still lecturing Fern. They slip inside the den, and Gary unlocks the locker in a tiny, bright hall just outside the den. Only Gary's silhouette can be seen extracting the jewels. Gary shifts out of the silhouette and emerges, handing the jewels to Martin, who exits. Gary shuts the window to the den, then ambles over to lock the locker. Smith observes Gary's expression, and they recline to ponder the issue seriously. Gary grimaces. Smith rises but halts abruptly as his EXECUTIVE dashes in. Smith begins to depart and rushes away. Gary smirks skeptically. Smith strolls over to Jean, then toward one of his engineers. The engineer waves and scurries off to instruct the runners. Smith ambles over to Johnson's booth as Gary descends the ladder. Smith reclines. Oliver dances at the dice table. Two porters approach him from the front, and the engineer shakes his head. They escort Oliver to the teller's booth, where Oliver drops his cards through the slot to the TELLER and glances around. We shift to Johnson's booth, who has observed the incident. Runners and porters burst in and seize Oliver. Gary stands motionlessly as they haul Oliver away. Back to Gary, still standing where he stood before, as a VISITOR meanders by. A feeling of quiet restlessness fills the hall. Gary steps to the center of the carpet and speaks in a very mellow voice. A handful of visitors are on the verge of departing. Gary peers toward Tim, who winks and begins to drum. Smith, Johnson, and Fischer lounge casually at their booth after observing the capture. Gary strolls by, halts, and strides over to their booth. Gary winks to Johnson and Fischer and reclines with them. Lieutenant Johnson is one of the factors the Empire State cherishes the fame it boasts today. Johnson produces a tiny red pamphlet from his backpack and flips to a particular page.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Rick sits at a table as Captain Tonelli and Lieutenant Casselle enter the cafe, passing Sam at the piano. They join Renault and discuss matters in Rick's office, where Rick retrieves money from a safe and hands it to Emil. Renault's aide interrupts, and Renault leaves hurriedly. Meanwhile, Ugarte is apprehended at the roulette table and taken away by guards, observed by Strasser, Renault, and Heinze. Rick stands calmly amid the tense atmosphere and signals Sam to play the piano. He then joins Strasser and Heinze, as Strasser refers to a black book, hinting at his role in the Third Reich.
